intro: Machaeranthera canescens subsp. ziegleri, commonly known as Ziegler's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, adapted to reduce water loss in dry climates.
